item.value: The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system.
There are 206 bones in the adult human body and are 300 in children. As children age some bones fuse together.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. It measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants. Los Angeles is in second place. It has 3.8 million people.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
Diamonds are the hardest substance known to man. A diamond is 58 times harder than the next hardest mineral on earth.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. Cheetahs can run much faster than people.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface. It is 155.557 million sq km.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The original Olympic Games were a series of athletic competitions held in Ancient Greece.
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The elephant is distinguished by its high level of intelligence, interesting behavior, methods of communication and complex social structure.
A shark can hear a fish in the water from more than a mile away.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
